text: Bottle. slightly cloudy yellow.Hoppy and slightly sour.Subtle bitter finish but not one of their best ones.

Bottle from a bottle swap, thanks Idealpint!
Not a beer for aging apparently, as the aroma suggests. Hoppy aroma, very nicely hoppy taste. But its not fruity anymore. I can see it was...

Rami Rami is drinking a DIPA V6 by Cloudwater Brew Co. at Muzeum Azji i Pacyfiku

O kurcze, jakie soczkowe owocowe, mango, mandarynki, cuda niewidy owocowe. Mimo wieku (po dacie!) zero utlenienia! Slodkie. Czad.
Not the most fresh IPA ive ever drank but still great fruitiness in aroma and also in taste, well body, cant even imagin how it taste whan was fresh

330ml bottle thanks to Jashiu.
Drunk on 12th march 2017 so not so fresh and generally I shouldnt rate it but I think its worth mentioning that even ageing this beer is still good and enjoyable and definitely not easy to achieve in such style. Congrats Cloudwater.

Bottle from The Bishops Cave, Bishops Stortford. Pours hazy orange/amber with a small white head. Aroma of mango, passion fruit, caramel and hop. Medium plus sweetness and bitterness. Medium to full body and rich texture, carbonation is average. Very good.

Bottle @ Grahams. Pours slightly hazy dark yellow with an offwhite head. Aroma of light malt, fresh fruity hops, peach, melon, grapes, mild citrus. Flavor is light sweet, rather bitter, malt, light caramel, rich tropical fruit, peach, pineapple, melon, light citrus. Medium body, lively carbonation, dry and rather bitter finish. Not really fresh, but still a nice beer, no sign of the 9%ABV. 180217

Bottle kindly shared by Grumbo. Big thanks :-) Hazy golden with a white head. Aroma is sweet, malty, caramel and moderate hoppy - grapefruit and fruity. Flavor is quite sweet and rather bitter. Dry and rather bitter finish with a little warming alcohol. 180217
Bottle. Medium head with medium duration. Color is light hazy golden. Aroma and taste are rich tropical fruits, flowers, malt, hops, citrus and has a nice long bitter finish.

Bottle shared with shartshorne. Rosy cloudy golden colour. Aroma is peach and mango, grapefruit and pine. Taste is dry and juicy, bitter and a touch sour. Dry pithy tongue leaves you wanting more, a little oil too. Bootiful.

Bottle shared with thanks to jackafholmes golden colour. Great big juicy tropics in aroma lovely!!! Taste sweet mango sour pithy grapefruit lots of pine nice long bitter hoppy finish. Very good no sign of abv

On tap @Buskers Pub (Rome). Dorata, leggermente torbida, schiuma media bianca, discretamente persistente. Al naso è fruttatissima, mango, papaya, ananas, pesca, anche una nota pinosa. In bocca è potentissima, attacco dolciastro maltato con finale amaro lungo e persistente. Corpo pieno, carbonazione media. Che botta!

Bottle at the Queens Head. How ironic Im rating this one now. I was drinking this beer back in August with a guy who I had a big crush on. For this reason, this is one of my all time favourite DIPAs.
Bottle. Cloudy gold. Medium white head. Medium bitterness. Light sweetness. Medium body. Aroma and flavour is pinneapple, blueberries, pine, spices, orange.

Bottle. Pours a hazy golden color with a small white head. Has a fruity malty peachy hoppy grassy aroma. Fruity malty grapefruit hoppy peachy grassy bitter flavor. Has a fruity malty grassy grapefruit hoppy peachy finish.

Bottle. Lovely grapefruit and pineapple aroma. Taste is even better. Lovely fruitiness, grapefruit again, pineapple again, light spiky bitterness, minerals, orange, sherbet. Tiny hint of booze, but in a lovely way. Great stuff
330ml Bottle - Hazy amber with a small head. Mango, orange and grapefruit in the aroma. Hoppy, fruity and tangy taste with orange, mandarin, grapefruit and mango.
Opaque and extremelly orange color. Taste is increndibly citrus however thick and syrupy in consistancy.

A very, very good double IPA. A fantastic citrus and fruit aroma with a strong, but soft hit of hops and and overall pleasant sweetness. It was richly flavoured with a very nice, slightly resinous, mouthfeel.

UPDATED: MAY 10, 2017 Keg @ The Magpie,Brentford. Drank from an elegant half tulip. £4.80 a half . Hazy peach coloured bier...subtle cream head is repressed. Nose of pine needles dancing around my nostrils... rich tropical club Tropicana citrus zest. Surprisingly malt assertive too. On the palate. Fruity nuances mentioned in the nose ...the malt balance is a little too balanced with unity...I like hops to dominate in this kinda thang. Interesting without being amazing.

Bottle, 330 ml, huge thanks to Max, shared with him and Matej. Pours hazy orange, creamy, dense, lasting white head. Fantastic hoppy aroma, lots of tropical fruit, mango, citrus. Just a bit sweetish, mango, some pine, peach, resinous and very juicy. Smooth. Lasting moderate to heavy bitter finish. Medium+ bodied.

November 29, 2016. Bottle at home. 
Hazy orange with a small creamy white head sticking to the glass. Aroma is fruity and light malty with lots of grilled and caramelized pineapple, mango, orange, pawpaw, melon, resin and some pine notes. Taste is medium sweet, fruity and smooth bitter. Medium bodied, soft carbonation. Smooth sweet and fruity finish with lots of ripe pineapple, mango, resin, smooth piney bitterness. 
Despite being three months this is great, held up very well. Still lots of juicy fruits and very drinkable.

Bottle from We Brought Beer. Been out of the loop a bit on UK beers recently and hoppy beers, but seen this is getting good ratings. As soon as I smelt the aroma, I understood why. Huge soft citrusy nose, grapefruit peel, grapefruit juice, orange peel, peach, pine, maybe hints of tropical fruit, passion fruit, mango, but mainly big fresh citrus fruit. Taste is big acidic fresh cirus fruit, bit of new sneakers plastic, peach, pine, grapefruit peel, grapefruit juice, orange peel, pale malts, sweet barley cereal.

330 ml bottle from Kris Wine, London, bottled 02/08/16.
Amber-orange, hazy body, with a medium, creamy, lacing, off-white head.
Aroma of citrus, orange, peach, biscuit, flowers, some tropical fruits, slight pine.
Tastes follows this, with more citric notes and some lemon candy.
Medium, oily mouthfeel, with an average carbonation.
Finishes bitter, moderate dry, citric, zesty, piney, floral, a bit astringent.

Very nice. Not that different to v7, maybe a bit more citric and a bit less malty. Really quaffable, with a well hidden ABV. Overall not my favourite one from the series, but a really enjoyable DIPA.

0,33l bottle at Saeglopurs place shared by him. Bottled 02.08.2016. BB 01/2017. orange cloudy color, medium big white head. smells of candy, parfumy, lightly zesty, light passion fruit, some mango, spices. nice smell. full body, soft carbonation, slick mouthfeel. tastes of spices, zesty notes, some grapefruit, bit caramel, some licorice, light mango, lightly peppery. finishes lightly bitter with notes of spices, licorice and zesty notes. overall nicely drinkable but also a bit weird, freshness most likely an issue here, but still quite good stuff.

UPDATED: NOV 3, 2016 Bottle. The Bank, Conwy. Pours opaque cloudy bright pale orange with yeast particulates. Medium carbonation. Strong aroma of Mango, tropical fruits. Taste is sweet fresh Mango, tangerine, like biting into fruit. Masks the ABV strength superbly Nice oily, full bodied palette. An exceptionally fresh DIPA, probably the best ive had

33 cl bottle. BBE 01/2017.
Pours cloudy orange color with a medium sized white head. Sweet tropical fruits on the nose, mango, pineapple, some tangerine, resin, lots of hops. Sweet fruity flavor too, pineapple, orange, mango, even some peach notes, resinous and oily hops, strong bitterness on the finish. A bit sweet but very tasty fruity DIPA.
4515

Bottle from Eltham Wines, Eltham. Hazy light amber pour with a white head. Oodles of sweet fruit in the nose. Flavours of peach, apricot, tangerine, mango. Light bitter twist in the finish. Lovely stuff.

Bouteille 33cl, merci Pierre T. Likely in the top Euro DIPA - just outstanding.
Dorée léger trouble, col blanc crémeux et soyeux assez tenace.
Arôme au nez finement fruité mais offrant une superbe palette de tropical - citronnelle, citron vert, mandarine avec le côté américain de Chinook - pin et forêt.
Palais est huileux, plein de houblon généreux - tropical avec une note accentuée de mandarine, touche épicée, pamplemousse, le tout rappelant un peu la Mandarine Napoléon avec un fini oscillant entre amer-aigre agrume et sucré résiduel.
Ne passe certainement pas pour 9%, superbe balance et mise en avant des différents houblons avec une base maltée qui sait rester discrète sans apporter ce mauvais profil belge dont certains semblent en faire leur signature.

Bottle with huge thanks to Ben! Pours very hazy golden, medium creamy off white head, dissipates with nice lacing. Aroma of dank pot, grass, onion. Flavor is light plus sweet, light bitter, dank, juicy with fairly prominent green onion. Medium body, creamy.
Keg @Salt Horse, Edinburgh [Rating Backlog]. Pours orange/amber, hazy with a white head. Nose is mango and orange. Taste is lime, oranges, other tropical fruits and a slight peppercorn finish.

Keg at the Magpie, cloudy gold with a lacing white head and a fruity nose, with notes of pineapple, resin, leafy hops and mango. Creamy texture with smooth tropical fruit, well hidden yet warming alcohol, dry-sweet spicy bitterness, floral hints ,and a bitter-sweet dry finish. Very very drinkable!
Pours unclear yellow, small white head. Smell is Rich, malty, thick, bit yeasty, mild bitterness. Taste is intense. Yeast, very aromatic and fruity. Extremely Nice ipa
This is a yellow cloudy beer, lighly carbonated, with a distinct citrus and grapefruit taste. Despite the 9% alcohol, it is extremely easy drinking, decidedly bitter and hoppy, but not unduly so.
Bottle. Also very sweet, hoppy and intense. Fruity, but no pines. Less citric. A bit sweaty. Still very nice.
Bottle. Hazy orange color with white head. Aroma is tropical fruits, sweatsocks. Taste is grapefruit, some more sweatsocks, milky yeasts, a bit boozy finish. Very nice!

Bottle sample at a tasting at troubless place. Thanks Tom L. Slightly hazy yellow with white head. The aroma has lots of fruits, tropical fruits (passion fruit) and citrus, perfumed. Bitter flavor with notes of citrus, some spiciness, herbs, a bit salty, tropical fruits, sweetish, melon, juicy. Medium-bodied. Excellent.

Bottle about 2 months after release. Pours opaque peachy orange with a large white head which recedes to a foamy layer, lacing the glass as it recedes. Aroma is peaches, mangoes, pineapple and a good dose of freshly cut grass throughout. Taste is sweet peaches, pineapple sweet, grassy bitter, malty biscuits are noticeable throughout as well as some caramel. Full bodied with a creamy mouthfeel.

Bottle sample at a tasting, thanks Tom L. Cloudy pale yellow. Aroma is fruity hops, tropical fruits (mango, peach) and pine. Sweet, fruity, juicy, mango, guava, bitter finish. Medium-bodied, smooth and extremely drinkable. Very good.

Aroma is big and dank hops, with mangos and juicy pineapple building up pressure. Taste is smooth, mega-juicy tropical fruits, citrus power. I catch some papaya as well. Ridiculously drinkable, and a treat for anyone whos into the more modern type of DIPA (read: sweeter and not that bitter).

Bottle at home. Pours a lovely cloudy orange/yellow with a small white head. Aroma is big pineapple, juicy clementine and slight grass. Taste is pineapple, mango, grapefruit, piney, resinous, grassy, big hop kick, long dry finish. Absolutely love this, everything I look for in an IPA.

13/20 Was perhaps expecting too much of this beer in the 100 club but I was pretty disappointed. Has an odd sour hoppy taste with a bit of grapefruit. Good depth of flavour and I admire the craft. Just not that mad on the taste. Extremely easy to drink considering it's 9%

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Slightly hazy light orange with a slim fading white cap. Nose is a decent puff of Yum-Yum sweetness, melon and toasted breadcrumb and digging deeper gets fairly citrusy and sweaty mango. Initial taste is crisp melon and grapey sweetness, furry key-lime and kiwi then a long undercooked dough breadiness. Carbonation is sleek, mouthfeel a decent swoop (cleaner than v7). Finishes soft juicy sweetness - decent tang of orange and lingers out quite dry and boozy.Bottle and topped up with various keg notes from fresh.

Bottle sample at a tasting at troubless place. Thanks Tom L. Cloudy yellow with tiny floaties. Great juicy fruity hops aroma, tropical, with some onion. Flavor is full of juicy fruity hops, very tropical. Medium-bodied. Really good.

Bottle. Pours hazy orange gold. Massive aromas of mango, tangerine, passion fruit and pine. Taste is moderate sweet with light bitterness. Nicely dank with lovely resinous finish. Just so easily drinkable and a pleasure from start to finish.
Many thanks to Rian for sharing! Smooth sweetish beginning. The hops are round and refreshing. Citrus on a mild and slightly smooth body. Easy to drink, refreshing with nice citrus hops. Very round.

Murky golden pour with a thick white head that lasts the whole glass. Loads of tropical fruits, mango, passion fruit, pineapple, grapefruit... Drinks far below its ABV, soft carb and thick, smooth mouthfeel... Not too sweet. Great DIPA.

Bottle at home, 9th September 16. Pours a murky orange beer, some head. Aroma is tropical fruit, mango, citrus, pine. Taste is full on, floral, tropical fruit, orange blossom, citrus marmalade, bitter bite, well balanced not overlly sweet, lots of grapefruit, creamy smooth and delicious. Was drinking 3 Flloyds Dreadnaught a few days prior to this, Cloudwater beat that for me with this DIPA.

Keg at Sourced Market, St P. 10/09/16. Hazy hoppy aroma
 Looks awwsme - a creamy gold, with a matching white head. Extremely smooth. Long finish. Bitter with a subtle kick. Think Im scoring lower than average due to the murky grapefruit flavour which Im not 100% about. Refreshing though. But worh £8?

Right now Cloudwater can do no wrong. This is a nigh on perfect DIPA. Pale cloudy gold, froth/lacing. Nose is hugely dank, primitive hops. Taste is intense fruit (oranges, melon, tangerine) backed up by buttery toffee sweetness and another huge hit of hops - resinous, bitter, dank. Palate is perfection - medium carbonation, effortlessly drinkable, and the 9%ABV is completely integrated. I could drink thins like a session pale ale.

Bottle at home in London - picked up at Offie & Toffee. Pours mostly clear orange-gold with a frothy, white head. The aroma leaps out of the glass. It is massively dank, with an ungodly amount of ripe, gooey citrus fruits, tangerine, mango, papaya, just suggestions of pale bread. The flavour is medium+ sweet with a strong bready base, but its really just there to support the onslaught of citrusy hops: tons more orange and mango, a bit of oily pine, cat bee, kiwi, melon, apricot, peach. Medium to full bodied with fine carbonation. Resinous on the finish, and lightly warming, with loads more gooey citrus and tropical fruits, more mango, fleshy peach, pear, orange. Insanely rich. This DIPA is absolutely world class. Cloudwater have really set themselves apart from most - if not all - of the rest of the UK where double IPAs are concerned.

Bottle. Pours a hazy golden orange with a lasting thin off white soft head. Aroma is of tropical fruits, mango, passionfruit, pineapple, butterscotch, grassy. Taste is of mango, passionfruit, melon, citrus, grapefruit, orange, slightly burnt on the finish, really juicy. Soft, foamy to oily mouthfeel, medium carbonation.

Bottle at the Maypole, Cambridge. Light yellow, incredibly hazy. Very little head. Aroma dominated by the scent of slightly overripe papaya, with mango, banana and lychee. Smooth sweet taste, with waves of tropical fruit and slight notes of butterscotch. Slight bitterness on the finish. Medium oily body, light carbonation. Coconut on the aftertaste. Very well made and duly enjoyed.

Pours cloudy straw/light orange with good white head. Aromas of mango and passion fruit with hint of lemon and pine. Fine bubbles for a fairly light carbonation but good mouth feel. Taste is of more tropical fruit with a touch of orange too. Slight yeast finish before the medium dry and light bitter finish. Very easy to drink!

Bottle. Hazy gold. Lots of tropical fruit on the nose; grapefruit, mango, etc. Nice full body, slightly sweet with loads of fruit again. Slight bit of sherbet. Very drinkable for the strength. All round really good.

Pours a cloudy yellow with a thin white head. The aroma is almost like lemon sherbet. The taste is not as hoppy as I had expected, it has a dull hoppiness in the background but mainly bitterness. A better DIPA from these guys than their last couple thats for sure.

Bottle from The Bottle Shop Bermondsey and drunk at home. Cloudy orange gold colour and white head. Dank hop aroma. Some tangerine flavour, some more dank hop. Then some beautiful orange fruit and some tropical fruit. Smooth almost a fruit smoothie like flavour. Hides ABV very well. Works better in bottle than on draught funnily enough. Light bitterness. Its excellent. Great in mouth. Love it.

Bottle shared with the family, Streatham, London (cheers Colin) (26/08/2016) - pours golden orange with a white head. Aroma and taste is a medley of sweet juicy tropical and citrus fruits, prominent grapefruit, tangerine, subtle sweet malty backing,pine needles, hoppy bitter finish. Lovely stuff, although the subsequent DIPA v7 just edged this for me.

Bottle from the offie Leicester. Aroma is mango, papaya and citrus. To taste this is so juicy! The alcohol level is perfectly matched with the hops to give a delicious example of the style. The bitterness and fruit go on forever on the palate. Very accomplished and a magnificent drop. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle from Bridgend Service Station, Freuchie. Pours with some haze. Pale peachy amber. Has a firm wee firm head. Great lacing. A wallop of sweet tropical fruits and pine hits you first. Really warm and musky. Plenty of mango. Orange. Bit of kiwi. Grapefruit galore. Bit of warmth from the alcohol but it adds to this beers depth. I got more yeasty esters in this version over v7. Taste has a solid sweetness which is not too syrupy or claggy. This is quickly ushered along by a spiky bitterness. Lots of grapefruit juice-like tang. Very pithy. Juicier and juicier as the finish rolls along. Great creamy yet slick palate. Bit of spice but the alcohol is integrated very well. Good body. Light but right carbonation. Excellent.

Bottle from Hops & Crafts Exeter,pours hazy gold ,thick foamy white head. Aroma of passion fruit,grapefruit,kumquat,mango,melon & tangerine lots of juicy fruit . Taste is fruity ,-another juice bomb,passion fruit ,pinapple,tangerine ,mango,grapefruit & some jaminess. Light bodied ,smooth ,yet fruit chewy,sweetish & yet there is some bitterness & dryness in the long tropical hop fruity finish . This is good!!!

Bittersweet tropical fruits, mango, melon. Hazy gold, tiny, creamy, white head. Heavy sweet. Very sweet citrus and tropical fruits, orange, juicy, sticky, sweet passion fruit and mango, soft carbonation, remains very sweet, medium bodied. Nice IIPA, but quite sweet. Keg at The Bottle Shop, Bermondsey.
Bottle at home. Pours golden orange, nose is toffee, grapefruit, orange, herbal, taste is juicy citrus, sweet, caramel.

330ml bottle from Ales by Mail. Bottled 02.08.16. Pours cloudy orange with a smooth white head. Aroma of fresh and juicy citrusy hops, tropical fruits, zesty grapefruit, mango, pineapple, grass, some caramely malts and pine. Taste is smooth, fresh, super juicy and fruity with loads of floral and citrusy hops, grapefruit, mango, tropical notes, pine, pith, pineapple and hints of malts. Finish is warming, hoppy and juicy fruity with loads of hops, tropical notes, citrus, floral notes, grapefruit and caramely malts. Fresh and juicy. Great stuff.

330ml bottle. Hazy, opaque, orangey golden colour with average, thick, creamy, fairly lasting and lacing, white head. Piney and tropical fruity, hoppy aroma, notes of pineapple, passion fruit, papaya, mango, grapefruit. Taste is moderately sweet, tropical fruity hoppy, notes of passion fruit, mango, papaya, pineapple, moderate bitterness; frozen fruit purée mouthfeel. Whoa! Extremely drinkable, superbly hidden alcohol, very fresh, sorbet-like fruit bomb.
Tap @ BrewDog Clerkenwell, small sample. Hazy yellow to golden color, short frothy head. Aroma of grapefruit, citrus, cookie. Bit cookie sweetness, fruity, citrus. Good one.

20th August 2016Very hazy gold beer, tidy pale cream colour head. Palate is light, mildly dry and has good fine carbonation. Light malts bring a pleasant level of sweetness. Spicy mango hops, pine, some generic fruit. More hop spice. Trace of sherbet. Finishes tropical and spicy. Lovely stuff, just a tad dry.

Bottle from Crafty Bottle, Lincoln. Hazy rich I range gold colour with a thick creamy white head. Aroma is juicy orange, pineapple and mango. The taste sweet fruity to mid bitter, with a bitter finish. Medium body. Wouldnt have guessed the high abv, as alcohol is hidden.

From 330ml bottle. Pours hazy gold with a white head fading to lacing. Big fruit cocktail aroma. Tastes fresh, fruity, complex palate of flavour which gives way to a slight bitterness. Another great DIPA from Cloudwater.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle from Salt Horse. Pours hazy yellow gold with a thin white head, nice lacing. Aromas of tropical fruit, mango, orange peel. Something herbal too. Taste is bitter, more tropical fruit, maybe green pepper. Medium body, hides the abv well. Bitter finish.

Keg at Red Squirrel Brewery Shop at Amersham, Saturday 20th August 2016   Pours hazy gold orangey colour with a white head atop, Soft in the mouth, really juicy its a great DIPA yet again from Cloudwater, nice aroma, good bittersweet punch, lovely beer, what I found most interestingly I had a sip of this and then Loz said to try some of her coffee (fresh coffee on site) I sipped this and without thinking went back to my beer again, wow that coffee was great and inadvertently sandwiched between two mouthfuls of beer made the best coffee IPA that Ive had in a while. so 3.9 for the standard version but 4.3 for the coffee IPA version :-). A7 A5 T8 P4 Ov15 3.9

Bottle at home picked up from. Beer shop St Albans, split with Sarah. A translucent golden orange coloured pour with a sticky off white head. Aroma is nice big spicy dank citrus fruits, tangerine, peach melba, slight hint of gherkin. Lovely sweet juicy tangerine and tropical fruits. Flavour is composed semi sweet Base malts, spicy citrus orange rind with peach and. passion fruit, prickly citrus rind. Palate is semi sweet, rounded, highish carbonation, juicy, little sticky hop resin.
Fantastic tropical fruit aroma, mango, kiwi and grapefruit. A light lemon flavour, the abv is well hidden, just giving a slight edge to the hop finish, balancing it out.

Bottle from a stall at the Maltby Street Market in Bermondsey. Ppurs hazy blond with an off white head. Big aroma of mango, papaya, grapefruit and pineapple. The taste has light spice before more tropical fruits. Theres underlying caramel and light spice before a pleasant moderately bitter finish. Very drinkable for the strength. Another great DIPA from Cloudwater.

Bottle at home, 18/08/16.
Golden orange with a well appointed off white head that retains well.
Nose is peach melba, sticky trops, sweet malts, cantalouple melon, pine needle, passionfruit.
Taste comprises orange wine gums, bubblegum, tangerine drool, mango, pine, hint of Um Bongo, sticky pineapple.
Medium bodied, soft massaging carbonation, juicy hop restrains in the close.
Solid DIPA, very easy drinking, like others in the series this Bois prefers a touch more dankness and bittering in my DIPAs ... great work none the less.
user_location: Hazlemere, the lower Xhitlerns, Buckinghamshire, ENGLAND

text: UPDATED: NOV 1, 2016 330ml bottle. Hazy pale orange colour with one-two finger head, good lacing. Aroma: Hoppy, loads of citrus and tropical fruit, orange and orange zest. Taste follows the aroma, juicy, loads of hoppy citrusy flavours, lots of orange, lemon, mango, some yeast, malt. Smooth mouthfeel, good carbonation, strong bitter finish. Great brew.

330ml bottle via Eebria. Pours hazy gold, frothy white head. Aroma is beautifully fruity, lots of orange juice and zest. Taste is exceptionally fruity and smooth, with plenty of orange juice and a nice bitter pithy edge. Soft yeast presence. Mid-way through, pineapple, mandarin and papaya come out to play, the whole thing blossoming wonderfully. Yes this is ace.

Keg. Appearance- hazy golden, with a thick cream head. Aroma- mango, pineapple, orange and citrus fruit, toffee malt. Taste is lemon, pineapple, mango, sticky sweet fruit, floral hops. Solid caramel malt presence, almost treacly. Full and sticky mouthfeel. Excellent.
(En fût au Festival of Dankness): La surprise de la journée. Entière, machable, fruité et élégamment comfortable. Assez tropical et floral avec une amertume chlorophyllienne modérée.

Bottle from Caps & Taps, London - UK. Color: hazy golden blond beer with medium carbonation and medium white foam. Smell: citrus and lime domination, grassy balance. Really juicy nose. Hoppy. Sweet finish. Taste: medium body with good malt structure balanced with hoppy blast with lime and lemon attack. Fruity and juicy. Very amazing. Good attenuation, superb balance. Easy drinkable. Perfect DIPA. It should be my favourite DIPA from Cloudwater... Good attenuation, not so on resin notes. Aftertaste: fresh, wet bitterness, sweet lime. No resin with strong bitterness. Amazing job! I love it!
Keg at Salt Horse. Pours hazy amber. Nose citrus, grapefruit, pineapple, peach. Taste is quite smooth and rounded, tropical fruits, passionfruit, pineapple, citrus, pine. Good stuff.
Keg at salty horse... Hazy Amber... Thin white lacing... Soft sweet passion orange nose... Bitter orange peel front.. Soft sweet tropical fruit.. Little too fizzy

Keg @ Piccadilly Tap, Manchester. Cloudy amber-orange with a thick frothy head. Ridiculously fruity for its strength, which is extremely well hidden by the abundance of tropical flavours. It has plenty of nose too, with a sticky-sweet texture.

UPDATED: SEP 23, 2016 Keg at Mason & Co, London. It pours a cloudy golden color with small white head. Aroma is danky fruity sweet yeasty with truck loads of mango pineapple grapefruit light dunk and yeast spiciness. Taste is also sweet and fruity with more tropical fruit salad notes, melon tangerine and danky weed. Light yeast notes. Medium bodied with good carbonation. Overall, very nice.
**********
33cl bottle via Beer Gonzo. It pours a cloudy golden color with a medium off white head. Aroma is bursting with tropical fruits, danky hops are light and in the background at the beginning, with more notes of mango, grapefruit, ripe melon, apricots. As it warms up, more danky weedy notes come through the nose. Taste is also mostly sweet and fruity upfront with notes of ripe peaches, mango, tangerine and a closing drying danky weed note. Medium to full bodied with creamy texture and good carbonation. Overall, fantastic DIPA, extremely well balanced. The bottled version impressed me much more than the draft one.

Bottle from Cork & Cask. Hazy golden body with a thick off-white head. Steady carbonation. Good lacing. Aroma of green stalks, pineapple, rhubarb and mango. Flavour of melon, creamy orange, lime chutney and tingly hops. Medium body with an oily texture. Light fizz. Alcohol barely noticeable. Buzzing with hops, but perhaps a touch too sweet. I preferred this to V7.

Golden, slightly hazy, with a small white head and some good lacing. Medium bodied with lively carbonation. Aroma is floral, with peach too and biscuity. Taste has lychee, kiwi fruit, white grape and lemon. Malt is restrained, as is the bitterness, letting the fruit linger into an excellent finish.leather,

Pours hazy golden with about a finger of white head. Aroma of passion fruit, apricot, peach, citrus, quite floral. Taste is rich, quite funky, sweet, like very ripe fruit, with a gentle bitter finish. Body is light and smooth, but carbonation is a bit too strong, almost lively.

330ml bottle at home in Richmond as Cloudwater DIPA v6, 9%, bottled less than 2 weeks ago. Vibrant opaque orange with a dense foamy white head, leaving full lacing. Looks great. Aroma is dank and tropical, pineapple, caramel, musty dried flowers. Body is smooth with tingly carbonation. Taste is sweet quenching fruits, peachy, caramelised sugars, pine, grassy finish. Lovely. A return to top form, I think. Yes its sweet, but everything is in balance.

Bottle from Fresh Fields Market, Croydon. It pours cloudy glowing orange with a medium white head. The aroma is rich, juicy, payaya, peach flesh, pineapple, lychee, white farmhouse bread, spice, straw and cereal. The taste is smooth, bitter, juicy, dank grassy vibe initially, which then moves on to tropical fruits, sweet pineapple in particular, lychee, nectarine and pomelo, There is a good deal of spice and alcohol heat on the back-end. Finish is dry, yet sweet and warming on the linger. Medium body and soft, foamy carbonation. Pretty great stuff overall, but perhaps a touch too sweet and warming.

Keg at Chesham brewery shop, Chesham, Bucks. A hazy golden/yellow coloured pour with a healthy white head on top. Rich hoppy, tropical fruit, mango aroma. Tastes similar, rich, hoppy, tropical fruit, mango, a little pineapple, dank and once again very sweet. Very nice DIPA but still too much sweetness for me. I had this up at the brewery a few weeks back and it was nowhere near as sweet.

Bottle from Cotteridge Wines. From the first smell, this is awesome. Delicious bright fruit. Meltis, Woolworths sherbet boiled. Splendid. Milk mouthfeel, with cloud. Cereal nut in the back, feint. Supreme DIPA.

Bottle: Nose is the traditional tropical hop bomb from this series of beer; mango, lychee, pineapple, slight yeast, over ripe mango, caramel slight dankness. Taste is sweet mango, pineapple, lychee, peach leading to malt, hint of cereal, light pine hint of mint, and a slightly dry finish which I dont remember from the other beers which is pleasing. 

Very nice, if a little too sweet and a little light on the hop bite as in previous versions. Still bought it on day of release mind....
Schooner Brewdog Edinburgh. Pours hazy gold, creamy persistent head. Great aroma if funky hops, grass, pine, mango. Same on the taste. Full bodied, smooth, complex. Another Cloudwater winner. Yummy.
On tap @ Hippo Taproom Glasgow cloudy golden beer aroma is tropical fruit flavours is hoppy mango pineapple some sweetness very hoppy dry bitterness on the finish

Bottle from Cotteridge Wines; hazy golden yellow pour with a big creamy off white head, aroma has clean hop freshness of mango, pineapple, along with some peach also spice coming through, taste has spritzy pine, mango, tangerine, sweet caramel, dangerously drinkable if you could get enough for a session, decent bitter finish, cant wait for version 14.
UPDATED: JUN 2, 2017 On tap at Brewdog Shepherds Bush. Pours cloudy and pale. Skunky weed aroma and big dirty hop flavours. Really good.

Tap. Cotteridge. Murky as you like, pale gold. Thin, blotchy, sticky, off white head. Nose has big tropical fruit. Ripe peach. Pineapple. Mango flesh. Some ripe strawberry. Notes of pine needle. Background of sweet, bready, vanilla malts. Smells fantastic. Taste is juicy, fleshy sweet, with clean, fresh hop bitterness. Dries out a little, balancing out the sweetness. Barely a trace of the 9%. Finishes long, light, fruity bitter. Super clean, and incredibly easy drinking.

1/3 pint on tap at The Hippo Taproom, Glasgow, pine, tropical fruits aroma, hazy golden with a very thin white head and good film of lacing, mango, tropical fruits flavour, very sweet, not fizzy, dangerously drinkable.

Keg, Brewdog Leicester. Hazy orange gold with a white head. Very sweet tropical fruit with mango and pineapple. Mellow grapefruit bitterness. Some peach and hints of dank grassiness. Lightly peppery alcohol. Massively drinkable for 9%.
